column4: this is a bit of a hack, but have you tried removing the entries in sources.list, running apt-get update, then restoring sources.list and rerunning apt-get update ?
the entries for main?
that fixed a funny bug i had with apt (it kept reporting archive.ubuntu.com didn't have 'partial support')
well, try everything except the CD
and dr_willis: specifically, my problem is that openoffice.org2-base is supposed to depend on java-gcj-compat OR j2re1.4 OR java2-runtime
does look wrong
is it not maybe one of the oo.o2 deps that is triggering that?
are you on amd64 ?
ppc. it's definitely oo.o2-base triggering
to (try to) debug this, why not try installing the gcj version, uninstall the sun version and see if it works?
you'd think the java2 virtual package would be all that would be required
because i don't want the gcj stuff at all. i want the ibm java i went through many hoops to get ubuntu to use
yeah, i said 'to debug' ;)
you mean see if it will try to uninstall oo.o2 if i install then uninstall gcj?
well, i meant to see if it will insist on need the other javas before nstalling oo.o2-base
ah, that's from your hoary install
oops
i didn't install hoary on this machine
sorry, was for sunshine
it's already trying to pull the third (java-gcj-compat) when the other two are listed as provided by my ibm-j2sdk1.4 pkg
my point is you suspect the OR has somehow become and AND; by removing the other java package, and providing the gcj package, you can test this claim
that wouldn't really test it because java-gcj-compat also provides the other 2 afaik. besides, they have no installation candidate in any repository
ah
anyway, i don't really think i'm helping you, sorry
